items.title: Bilingual (Japanese) Software Consultant | Tokyo, Japan
items.content:
*INTRODUCTION*

Hello. We are a well-established, high-growth, investor-backed consulting firm. Very much boutique, with an almost startup-like approach and feel, we have big company ambitions. And a track record to prove it.

*OUR CULTURE?*

Tech-savvy, innovative, entrepreneurial, collaborative. Our consultants are fiercely loyal and this is borne out by a very low attrition rate.

*WHAT DOES A TYPICAL DAY LOOK LIKE?*

* Imagine owning the proof of concept, design, architecture, development and delivery of client solutions.
* Imagine engaging with developers, business analysts, change professionals, project managers and other stakeholders.
* Imagine being the face of the firm, showcasing solutions, outlining benefits, identifying future business opportunities.
* Imagine using your business acumen to ensure technical implementations are fit for purpose.

*WHAT'S INTERESTING ABOUT THE ROLE?*

In many ways you will feel like your own boss. You will need to be independent, adaptable and able to travel extensively throughout APAC and at times, globally, to client sites. The role will bring lots of autonomy and flexibility including a significant opportunity for remote working.

*WHAT ARE THE CHALLENGES?*

If you enjoy the formal structure of a corporate environment then this is not for you. You will need be self-motivated and versatile enough to wear multiple hats i.e. consultant, project manager, business analyst, technician, mentor, advisor. You will have a network of consultants to support you in the early days but thereafter you will be expected to stand on your own two feet.

*WHAT'S MY BACKGROUND?*

You come from a technical hands-on development (.NET, Java, C# or similar) environment but now operate in a more strategic, consultative, client-facing role which might encompass disciplines such as solution architecture, business analysis, project management and the like.

*PROGRESSION?*

This is a fantastic opportunity to be part of an exciting success story and to grow with a firm that has world-class ambitions. In many ways progression will be exactly what you make it.

*WHAT TECHNICAL SKILLS WILL I NEED?*

* Programming background in .NET, Java, C# or similar.
* An understanding of object-orientated, structured development methodologies.

*WHAT BUSINESS KNOWLEDGE WILL I NEED?*

* Good understanding of project management, software development life cycles, structured programming methods and controls.
* An affinity for consulting, business analysis, change management, process re-engineering, business transformation.
* Prior experience of designing and implementing documented, supportable and extensive developments for clients.
* Able to solve business and technical challenges by using innovative and well-planned approaches.

*SOFT SKILLS?*

* Highly personable, engaging, client-facing, confident, credible, articulate, consultative, affable, charismatic.
* Gravitas and credibility to face off to senior business stakeholders, able to instil confidence.
* Sixth sense for identifying, troubleshooting and remediating issues, both business and technical.
* Sound commercial nous coupled with excellent stakeholder management skills and a strong technical background.
* Able to tailor a message to the audience, combined with exceptional presentation skills.
* International outlook and exposure, you will most likely have worked abroad at some point.
* Bilingual Japanese/English skills are essential.

*THE NUMBERS?*

JPY 12,000,000 + excellent benefits + share options.

*INTERESTED?*

Please apply including a copy of your CV and cover letter (yes we're a bit old school like that). We look forward to hearing from you.

items.content:
Senior UI/UX Consultant
Accolite Inc -Remote
Contract

Job Summary

Role: Senior UI/UX Consultant (10+ Years Exp)

Location: Remote (20% Travel required all over USA)

Duration: Long Term Contract

Required Skills:

  • Impeccable customer communication skills; consulting background preferred
  • Solid background creating web applications and web sites including consuming Restful APIs *

*

  • Strong JavaScript/JQuery experience, bonus points for Node, Angular or other similar JavaScript frameworks. *

*

  • Self-motivated; you don't require supervision and can set your own priorities
  • Server-side Java experience or similar technologies (PHP, ASP) a plus
  • Experience with closure templates like Soy or Free marker is preferred
  • Detailed understanding of the latest web design trends, technologies, techniques, and patterns
  • Ability to work well in a fast-paced environment and thrive on creative problem-solving
  • Equally passionate about user experience and interface design
  • Yoda-like knowledge of CSS and HTML and ability to hand-code your way out of the nastiest problems

Portfolio Required:

Job Type: Contract

Required experience:

  • HTML: 5 years
  • UI: 10 years
  • CSS: 5 years
  • UX: 10 years

Required travel:

  • 25%

items.title: Online English Teacher, Part time Tutor, Remote
items.content:
Online English Teacher, Part time Tutor, Remote - Jobmote

Online English Teacher, Part time Tutor, Remote

Qkids

ABOUT QKIDS: Qkids is a unique, interactive online English program. We connect English teachers to Chinese students with fun, user-friendly software. Qkids is ready to build lasting growth for both students and teachers. With your help, we can continue to impact cross-cultural communication positively. Join today, and let's shape the future of E-Learning together!

Teacher testimonial video : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Zs9_Z0XSJ00

CONNECT ON

Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/JoinQkids/ 

Glassdoor : https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/QKids-Reviews-E1339997.htm

About the Job:

Employment type: Contract, part-time

Start date: ASAP

Location: Remote

Hours: 6-19 hours/week

Rate: $16-20 USD/hr

 

R** ESPONSIBILITIES:** Teach English to Chinese children between 5 - 12 years of age through Qkids’ interactive software program. Knowledge of Chinese is not necessary. Each class is 30 minutes. All curricula are preset and incorporated with animated characters and games. There is paid training before orientation. Further training and support is provided along with your coursework.  

R** EQUIREMENTS:**

  1. Available to teach a minimum of 6 hours (12 classes) per week from the following timeslots. There are 19 hours (38 classes) available weekly: every day: 05:40 - 06:10, 06:20 - 06:50, 07:00 - 07:30, 07:40 - 08:10, plus additional Friday and Saturday timeslots: 19:40 - 20:10, 20:20 - 20:50, 21:00 - 21:30, 21:40 - 22:10, 22:20 - 22:50. All as in EST.

  2. Native fluency English speakers who are based in United States, Canada. This is due to the limitation of our internet server and we do not discriminate against nationality.

  3. Earned a degree or currently enrolled in a university program.

  4. Prior teaching experience or experience with early childhood education. 

Hiring process: Application - invite to pre-demo - demo(paid) - trial classes (paid) - Hired!

items.title: Full Time Instructor - Data Science Master's Program - Rasmussen College - Remote
items.content:
Full Time Instructor - Data Science Master's Program
Rasmussen College -Remote
This role reports the Academic Dean.

Teaching Workload:

Full-time Instructors are assigned 5 work units per academic quarter as follows:
  • 3.75 work units for instruction
  • 1.25 work units for scholarly work
Required Qualifications:
  • A doctoral degree in Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, Data Mining, Data Science, Big Data, or other data-driven technology. If doctoral degree is not in one of the areas listed above, a doctoral degree in Computer Science with a specialty in one ofthe listed areas or a doctoral degree in Computer Science two years field experience is required.
  • A minimum of three years of teaching experience at the graduate level is required.
  • A successful candidate should have expertise or experience in the majority of the following technologies: OLAP, OLAP for Data Mining, SQL, SAS, JAVA, R, Python, C++, Java, SQL, NoSQL, SQL Server, SAS, ETL, and Data Transformation Tools.
  • Additional consideration will be given to candidates who possess any of the following current certifications: Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP), SQL Certification, SAS Certification, and/or Tableau Certification.
About Us:

Rasmussen College is a regionally accredited private college that is dedicated to changing lives and the communities it serves through high-demand and flexible educational programs. Since 1900, the College has been committed to academic innovation and providingthe highest standard of education while empowering students to pursue a college degree. Rasmussen College offers certificate and diploma programs through associate’s, bachelor’s and master’s degree programs online and across its 22 Midwest and Florida campuses.A pioneer in online education, the College is helping lead advancements in innovations such as competency-based education and comprehensive student support services that help working adults advance their careers. The College is also committed to providinga positive impact on society through public service and a variety of community-based initiatives. For more information about Rasmussen College, please visit rasmussen.edu .

At Rasmussen, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed supporting and encouraging diversity in the workplace. We welcome our employee’s differences regardless of race, color, creed, religion, gender, national origin, sexualorientation, marital status, age, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

items.title: University level tutors
items.content:
My Uni Tutors is actively seeking a passionate private tutor in London to teach different topics including: business, finance, computer science, physics, maths and engineering fields to undergraduate students. We look for excellent tutors with a track record in teaching who can tutor, support and mentor students to reach their potential.

Requirements :

- A proven track record as a professional teacher or private tutor.

- Good knowledge of the UK school curriculum.

- Degree educated.

- A passion for teaching and ability to get the best out of students.

- A valid DBS.

- Ability to travel to students’ homes/our office on time for each lesson.

Working with My Uni Tutors:

We handle the collection of payments from clients and pay tutors weekly for lessons taught. This leaves you free to teach and you don’t need to worry about chasing students for payment.

As a self-employed tutor, you’re free to pick and choose who you want to teach.
For more information please read the terms and conditions on our website.

items.title: Corporate Partnerships (Contractor)
items.content:
Corporate Partnerships (Contractor) at Liven

Melbourne, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Sales Strategy and Management, Sales and Marketing, Sales/Marketing and Strategic Partnerships
Compensation
$40K–$50K
No Equity

Job Description

Liven is an exciting new company which has been growing rapidly since launching 18 months ago. We believe in getting more from life and our mission is to help Australians enjoy new experiences while being socially conscious and without breaking the bank.

Customers use our app to save money at restaurants, pay their bill directly through the app like Uber, and to share their saving with a charity if desired using our Save & Donate feature.

We have partnered with 9 of Australia’s favorite charities to make this possible in the world’s first system of this type.

We are looking to expand our customer base, and need the help of talented business development specialists to drive this growth. We are seeking well-presented professionals with excellent social and interpersonal skills.

You will:

-Identify and target Corporations in Melbourne, Sydney and Brisbane with 200+ employees who would like to add our membership to their employee salary packages as an additional benefit
-Identify and target local Sporting and Social Clubs and Charity organizations that have 100+ members or followers who can sell our memberships as a fundraising tool to support their club
-Approach these bodies, educate them about Liven and what we can provide them. This will require calls, emails, and face to face meetings
-Negotiate and sell Liven premium memberships to these bodies in bulk

Requirements

-Warm personality that makes people comfortable talking with you
-Confidence, even in the face of rejection
-You should be able to demonstrate a history of exceeding targets in sales
-You must be well presented and carry yourself with a professional demeanor at all times

Benefits

-Become an early employee of a fast-growing, exciting startup
-Have an impact on the company’s growth and evolution, with the potential to work in different cities as the company expands
-Uncapped commission structure, the potential to share in significant revenue if you work effectively

items.title: Fundraisers / co-workers - to Combat Climate Change
items.content:
Fundraisers / co-workers - to Combat Climate Change at ACT Cooperative Corporation AS

Oslo, Remote · Cofounder
Skills
Sales, Social Media Marketing, Sales and Marketing, Communication Skills, Digital Marketing, Crowdfunding
Compensation
No Salary
0.5%–1.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

ABOUT ACT
ACT’s Core Infrastructure team is seeking an iOS developer to help build the zero carbon footprint future version of our planet. Sounds interesting? Read on.

ACT’s Core Infrastructure team is seeking fundraisers to help build the zero carbon footprint future version of our planet. Sounds interesting? Read on.

We believe that the core problem of global warming is lack of global collaboration. Our goal is to support and enhance global collaboration facilitated by an ecosystem of carefully crafted software systems. Just like Wikipedia is a computer facilitated collaboration platform around building the world’s biggest encyclopedia – so will ACT enable collaboration around green shopping and help humans ACT together for a sustainable planet so that we can do our part to end global warming and also support fair trade.

- ACT is software technology with smart gamification to connect consumers around sustainable shopping and collaboration.
- The immediate goal of ACT is to reduce climate gasses and possibly be the “solution” to global climate change.
- ACT is a role model of a democratic organization: Max factor of 8 between highest and lowest paid, all employees has 1 vote, no person or organization can own voting shares (i.e. no external organization can control ACT, which is important to keep us a partner of independent advice).
- All software is expected to be open source and free, so that all can take action.

We have just finished a major design phase and now wish to start serious development of the software platform. We are looking to tell the world about our extraordinary solution for ACTion, that we believe will change the way we manage global climate change almost overnight.

We need to strengthen our team, our advisory board and council with experienced resources within multiple fields: Management, Communication/journalism/marketing, Financial management, Fundraising, Life cycle analysis & research, Graphical design, Web development, Mobile development, Backend development, Networking.

WHY ACT?
Have you ever thought that it is impossible to solve global climate change and that your effort would mean so little?

What if you had the chance to work with one of the most ambitious climate change projects? We believe that ACT is one of the most hands-on solutions to mitigating climate change. These might sound like just 'great words,' but do the math yourself: E.g. If only 1700 people decided to use ACT to find the least fossil fuel consuming goods, service alternatives and register their purchases it would deliver a combined purchasing power of 63 million USD/year after tax*, which is the same amount Norway uses to conserve the Amazonas rainforest! And those 1700 people could decide to ACT tomorrow!

* Assuming a salary of 37,000 USD/year after tax.

JOB DESCRIPTION, FUNDRAISERS / MARKETEERS
ACT is now selling shares and applying for funding with various organizations. We need 2 highly motivated FUNDRAISERS / MARKETEERS to join our Core team in this exciting phase that will have a serious impact on sustainability of our planet.

At best the following requirements apply to you:

- You have applied and won support from Innovasjon Norge on multiple occasions.
- You have applied and won support from various other foundations.
- You have experience from selling shares.
- You have a good network.
- You have a good command of English.

The fundraisers will work closely with co-founders and be a part of our small team of entrepreneurs with a flat organizational structure. Since the company is in an early phase you will be able to shape your role in the company exactly how you like it best.

WORK PLACE
This job should at best be carried out as much as possible in co-location with ACT in Oslo, but we are open to remote work too.

APPLICATION
Please send your CV and some words introducing yourself, why you want to work with ACT, highlight relevant previous experience and your current situation.

For more information about this job and ACT please contact:

Thomas Jepsen
President, Founder & CTO
ACT Cooperative Corporation AS

items.title: Axiom Zen | Vancouver, B.C. Canada & US Remote | Relocation available
items.content:
Axiom Zen | Vancouver, B.C. Canada & US Remote | Relocation available

Axiom Zen is a venture studio specialized in applying emerging technologies (AI, blockchain, and some AR) to unsolved business problems.

We are looking for new team members across a variety of verticals, but especially strong developers and technical PMs with a demonstrated aptitude for understanding the underpinnings and impact of decentralized tech.

If that's you, shoot me an email and I'll connect you with the right folks: r@axiomzen.co

Axiom Zen is the team behind CryptoKitties, the first game on the blockchain; ZenHub, the leading collaboration solution for technical teams; and Toby, the top-rated tab management solution picked as top Chrome Extension of the Year by Google and Product Hunt. Products developed by Axiom Zen have touched 200+ million consumers and are used by the world’s leading companies. We have a team of ~80 creatives including published authors, over a dozen former founders, diversity from 33 national origins, and experience at both startups and Fortune 500s.

items.content:
Grand Cloud | Software Consultant, DevOps Consultant | Western United States | REMOTE & ONSITE, FULL-TIME, CONTRACT | https://www.grandcloud.com/

We're a small consulting shop tackling projects other companies deem impossible. We currently have multiple clients ranging from large enterprises in retail and ad tech space to small startups in fintec and education. We work with the latest technologies such as Kubernetes, Istio, Vault, Consul, etc. on Infrastructure and develop applications with Corda, Kotlin, Scala, gRPC, etc. For data platforms we are using FaunaDB, Spark, Cassandra, etc.

We're looking for engineers who enjoy a diversity of projects and are self-directed:

Backend Engineers / Consultant -> experience in the JVM ecosystem (Scala, Kotlin or Java) and Data Technologies (Cassandra,Spark,etc.)

DevOps Engineers / Consultant -> experience with the HashiStack, Kubernetes and Infrastructure Automation

CryptoCurrency / Smart Contract Engineers / Consultant -> experience with Corda, Blockchain, etc.

On-site opportunities available in the western US. Remote opportunities worldwide.

Email me directly at ryan at grand cloud

items.title: SEEKING FREELANCER - Remote (US or Canada specifically)
items.content:
SEEKING FREELANCER - Remote (US or Canada specifically)

Looking for deep learning tutorial writers/creators to make deep learning technology screencasts.

Specifically those who know or are starting out one or more of the following technologies: TensorFlow, PyTorch, CNTK, MXNet (python, jl, c++, etc), Keras, Gluon, DL4J, DeepLearn.js, Torch, Caffe2, Caffe, Paddle, TFLearn, dlib, Theano, chainer, DIGITS, dynet....

The topic area would be yours to choose.

I would help you come up with specific tutorials to start out with.

I pay $50 USD per video, pay for your equipment, and pay ongoing royalties on a monthly basis (with a minimum royalty payout of $600 for the first year)...

I also give you suggestions on video topics so that you don't have to come up with them at the start...

I also do the video editing and transcribing for you...

if interested:

website -> https://www.aiworkbox.comemail -> sebastian@aiworkbox.com

Stop wasting your talent placing ads, working in finance or building yet another social networking app, join us to improve healthcare in America. The systems we build help millions of American afford their medications and bring transparency in the complicated space of pharmacy benefits.

items.title: Sift | Detroit, MI | Fulltime | ONSITE | https://www.justsift.com
items.content:
Sift | Detroit, MI | Fulltime | ONSITE | https://www.justsift.com

At Sift, we build applications to help organizations better understand their people. We want organizations to feel more like closely knit teams, where everyone supports each other to achieve their shared mission.

We’re just around 2 years old, but we’ve already secured 15,000+ users and over 20 clients. We’re proud to have Quicken Loans using our apps to better understand who makes up their amazing team.

- Backend (Node.js, Express- DevOps (AWS, Azure, moving to containers) (REMOTE possible)

We are mostly looking to grow our backend engineering team. Our current stack is NodeJS and AWS Services (EC2, S3, DynamoDB, ElasticSearch, Lambda).

No experience with JavaScript but have an interest? Reach out!

Shoot me an email!

Mat P, CTO, matp@justsift.com

items.title: Blogger
items.content:
FundingHealthcare is a passionate, empowering community based crowdfunding enterprise. We work alongside healthcare providers to help them fund healthcare-related projects that are of utmost importance in their communities.

This is a position, for those of moral conviction, who feel passionately about the state of the healthcare system and will fight to improve it, to enable all to benefit, and none to lose out.
We are a small company, but with big hearts, and even bigger ambitions, and as such this is a voluntary opportunity and therefore unpaid. This opportunity does allow the right candidate to change the world starting with the health of the nation!

Job outline
FundingHealthcare is looking for a blogger, a wordsmith, or an article engineer to create interesting, engaging and inspiring content of high quality in order to engage the reader with ongoing fundraising community projects.
As the blogger in chief, it is your job to highlight issues within healthcare, surrounding the projects that are underway, in addition to exploring concepts and coming up with new areas for discussion. Currently we are looking for a UK focus, however this could change. There is a lot of positive that is done, and it is our job to support and nourish it.

We honestly want all angles for this. Whether you are a nurse, or medical practitioner, confined to a bed, or simply know someone who has been ill and want your opinions heard.

Responsibilities
• Ensure content is innovative, interesting and engaging
• Create engaging, high quality content
• Ensure posts are regular and scheduled
• Engage with members of the community who are attempting to inspire through commitment to healthcare
Requirements
• Excellent writing skills
• Ability to think creatively, yet research thoroughly creating high quality product
• Experience writing blogs or similar
• Multi-tasking with a flexible approach
• Work under pressure to tight deadlines

Commitment
As much time as you can give. However it depends on availability.

Location
Remote- wherever you are able to concentrate!

This is a voluntary, unpaid role; however, it affords the chance to showcase your skills and gain experience simultaneously helping to create a better healthcare environment for all.

items.title: Sportswriter (Part-Time / Remote)
items.content:
Sportswriter (Part-Time / Remote) at Overtime

New York City, Remote · Contract
Compensation
$0K–$1K
No Equity
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

** TO APPLY: Contact sam@itsovertime.com with a sample article using any video from Overtime's social media or app. Read below for more info **

Overtime has a select number of part-time opportunities for Sportswriters located anywhere in the world.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

• Write articles using your own videos and others from the Overtime platform
• Work directly with our Editor In Chief and Director of Digital Content to pitch article ideas that will be featured on our website and social media -- which reaches millions worldwide
• Act as an ambassador for the Overtime brand and actively try to grow our community of athletes, coaches, fans and fellow Sportswriters

REQUIREMENTS:

• You love sports
• You're hungry AF
• You have some writing or social media experience

ABOUT OVERTIME:

Based in NYC, Overtime is funded by Greycroft Ventures, 645 Ventures, Fitz Gate Ventures, other leading VC firms and includes David Stern and NBA players among its investors. The company was co-founded with WME | IMG, the largest sports agency in the world, and the team behind Overtime is responsible for mobile apps with hundreds of millions of downloads worldwide.

TO APPLY:

Send your resume/LinkedIn and a sample article featuring a video you found on @Overtime's Instagram or Twitter or our iPhone app to sam@itsovertime.com

items.title: Senior UX Consultant
items.content:
// Salary dependent on experience //

Come and join a boutique interaction and service design consultancy and work on challenging interaction design and research projects for high-profile e-commerce, charity and government clients.

You’ll be working directly with the founders but you’ll still have lots of autonomy and the opportunity to define and steer our approach to projects.

- You’ll want to join a small company and be a core part of its growth
- You'll want to develop your skills by working with some seasoned consultants
- You'll want to work in a company where UX - research and design - is our main service
- You’ll be entrepreneurial, love your work & be very good at what you do
- You are excited by the potential of design and technology to have a positive effect on lives
- You care about the details of the work

Your experience

- You’re very confident at communicating ideas and concepts
- You're very confident prototyping user journeys and creating unbranded templates as wireframes and clickable prototypes
- You're confident conducting and analysing research - user insight, usability, remote and face to face
- You’ve probably run multivariate and testing
- You’re confident working with Google Analytics and HotJar
- You're confident presenting to stakeholders
- You have experience of working on high traffic ecommerce projects or charity projects or government projects
- You have a UX background but you know this isn’t just about screen design - your eye is on the design of the service
- You probably have a degree or MSC in a design or HCI related area
- You probably have 6+ years of experience

Working conditions

We're based on King St in central Bristol, most of our clients are in London, so you must be happy with occasional travel.

We’re open to flexible working and we are family orientated.

Currently our priority is finding the right full time person for this permanent role but we'd also like to connect with people looking for freelance work.

We’re looking for someone to start in January 2018.

Salary depending on experience.

items.title: Chief of Staff - Crossover - Remote
items.content:
Chief of Staff
Crossover -Remote
$30,000 a year - Contract
Ready to make $30,000 while working from the comfort of your home? Eager to join a network of the most talented remote workers in the world? If so, this role is for you. Work for Crossover, and you’ll earn the most competitive wages on the market and collaborate with the most skilled teams in your field.

Job Description:

Join Crossover and you’ll be part of a team responsible for designing, coding, testing, debugging and maintaining various digital media applications. We strive to keep current on the latest trends in mobile technologies, so you’ll be expected to effectively lead team members and act as a technical reference. We’ll want you to clearly explain various technologies and solutions to both technical and nontechnical stakeholders. During any events and games, you will provide phenomenal support for live products. You will develop and support front-end, online mobile product initiatives. You will be responsible for creating and iterating excellent software applications with top quality user experience. On a bigger scale, you will work together with other developers, engineers, and production groups to design and implement new applications, systems, and tools that are unparalleled in the market.

Required Education or Experience:
  • At least 3 years of experience building high-traffic and large scale Android apps

  • Committed to producing code that follows the best practice’s of the industry

  • Previous experience with other mobile platforms (not required but desired)

  • Experience developing complex apps

  • Proficiency in the following skills and technologies is mandatory:

    • Android SDK Java, Swift, SOAP, REST

    • OO programming and design patterns

    • HTML5, JavaScript, jQuery, Ajax and jQuery

    • WebServices and consume APIs

    • Garbage Collection desired but not required

  • Proficiency in iOS and xCode is desired but not mandatory

You might be a good fit if:
  • An ability to quickly and eagerly learn new technologies

  • Demonstrated ability to take responsibility for projects and determine their trajectory

  • Ability to consistently meet deadlines even while running multiple projects

  • Excellent communication skills with a wide range of individuals (in English)

  • Collaborative and communicative team player

Total compensation: $30,000/year

Location: Global (remote)

40 hours per week

We’re one of the few legitimate companies offering high-paying jobs that are 100% remote, work from home. You never have to fight traffic to the office again and you have the freedom to choose when and where you put in your 40 hours to be most effective each week.

However, it is important to note that while you will work as a "contractor," these are long-term contracts that should be your only source of employment. You are not permitted to work additional jobs on the side. Please do not apply unless you are available to make this position your sole employment.

To qualify, please provide a resume/CV demonstrating the required experience and skills. From there, to help us find the top 1% of talent, there will be a series of interviews and online skills examinations. We realize these are challenging and can require a decent amount of time - so we thank you in advance for your efforts.

items.title: Technical Pre-Sales/Field Consultants at Octopus Deploy () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Senior
Role: DevOps
Industry: Continuous Delivery, DevOps, Software Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Octopus Deploy is the most popular deployment automation tool in the world, and large enterprises are standardising on Octopus as their company-wide deployment tool of choice. This presents many interesting architectual considerations, design challenges, and issues that we need you to help our customers navigate. 

We're looking for two new team mates in the United States, who can help large customers who have already adopted, or planning to adopt, Octopus Deploy. A typical day in the role might include:

  • A video call with a potential customer who's considering Octopus (and modernizing their software delivery stack more generally), and giving them a tailored demo of the product and how it might help them. 
  • Putting together architectual diagrams or writing up advice on how a particular customer should implement Octopus for their entire organization
  • Following up with potential customers who need help building a proof-of-concept deployment pipeline with Octopus
  • Helping a customer's security team understand the best practices for using Octopus and what impacts Octopus might have for them
  • Representing Octopus at conferences around the US and talking to Octopus users face-to-face

If you know Octopus, have a passion for seeing customers improve their CI/CD pipelines or adopt a DevOps approach more broadly, and are comfortable talking with small groups of people, this role is a chance to make a big difference. 

A person in this role would ideally:

  • Have implemented Octopus before at some scale, and know the tool well
  • Have good knowledge of other CI/CD tools
  • Have some experience in a client-facing role – e.g., in consulting
  • Have a mix of technical skills, ideally with experience development, release management or operations
  • Be great at written and verbal communication
  • Be organised and good at managing their time/setting expectations
  • Be relatively experienced and understand the realities of life in a large enterprise

Most of our team is based in Australia, so this will be a remote role - you'll spend most of your time working from home. When you start we'd like to bring you to Brisbane, Australia for a few weeks to meet the team and as part of the onboarding/training program. There will also occasionally be some travel to attend conferences/trade shows that Octopus is exhibiting at. 

About Octopus Deploy

We make Octopus Deploy, an automated deployment tool. Since 2012, we've grown organically and have over 20,000 customers around the world including 25 of the Fortune 100. Our software is used by teams to deploy .NET and Java applications to hundreds and thousands of production servers in the cloud and on-premises. 

We are a small team that believe in building high-quality software. We ship new releases often, plan our milestones and major features in public, and take the time to do things right rather than rush. As an ISV, we know that our code is an asset to be invested in, not an expense to be minimised. If doing it right means it takes longer, so be it. 

While most of our team is based in Brisbane or other parts of Australia, everyone works from home most of the week, so we've built a remote-first culture. We have a flexible schedule and working arrangements, and our team works mostly from home or occasionally from an office in Brisbane. We have a well-defined career path for developers, and a standardised approach to compensation and coaching. We ensure you have the right tools with our choose your own hardware program. 

Benefits

Work from home in a remote-first organization
Family-friendly, flexible schedules
Choose your own laptop, plus additional hardware budget
Modern technology, exciting challenges
Competitive salaries
Good, fun people who take pride in their work
No deathmarches; quality work takes time
Our customers are developers too, and they love what you build

items.title: Virtual Assistant
items.content:
We at Centene Corporation are looking for a Virtual Assistant to provide administrative support to our team while working remotely As a Virtual Assistant, you will perform various administrative tasks, including answering emails, scheduling meetings and making travel arrangements. For this role, a strong Internet connection is required, along with experience using communication tools like Skype.Ultimately, you should be able to handle administrative projects and deliver high-quality work under minimum supervision.
Responsibilities
  • Respond to emails and phone calls
  • Schedule meetings
  • Book travel and accommodations
  • Manage a contact list
  • Prepare customer spreadsheets and keep online records
  • Organize managers’ calendars
  • Perform market research
  • Create presentations, as assigned
  • Address employees administrative queries
  • Provide customer service as first point of contact
  • Proven experience as a Virtual Assistant or relevant role
  • Familiarity with current technologies, like desktop sharing, cloud services, and VoIP
  • Experience with word-processing software and spreadsheets (e.g. MS Office)
  • Knowledge of online calendars and scheduling (e.g. Google Calendar)
  • Excellent phone, email and instant messaging communication skills
  • Excellent time management skills
  • Solid organizational skills
  • High school diploma; additional qualifications as an Administrator or Executive Assistant are a plus

To apply: Interested candidate should send resumes to centene.interviewdesk03@gmail.com

items.title: Virtual Assistant
items.content: We are looking for a responsible and resourceful virtual assistant to join our team. Working remotely, the virtual assistant will organize and update files, answer calls and emails, and assist in creating presentation and sales materials. The ideal candidate should be tech savvy, able to communicate through multiple channels, and super organized. The virtual assistant will also be responsible for arranging travel itineraries, flights, and rooms, as well as tracking and managing expenses and payments.

items.title: Technical Instructor - Workday - Home Based
items.content:
Technical Instructor
Workday -Home Based
Join our team and experience Workday!

It's fun to work in a company where people truly believe in what they're doing. At Workday, we're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business of enterprise applications. We work hard, and we're serious about what we do. But we like to have a good time, too. In fact, we run our company with that principle in mind every day: One of our core values is fun.

Job Description

Job DescriptionWorkday's Knowledge Management group is looking for professional Instructors who have experience that runs the entire gamut of training -- from course concept to development to delivery. This position will support our Cross Application tools that include Reporting, Security, Business Process Framework and Integrations.

About the Team

Workday Education is responsible for teaching Workday’s market-leading technology to our partners and customers. Our innovation doesn’t stop with our applications. It continues in our approach to learning. Whether in our state-of-the-art classrooms or other exciting mediums, we work hard to use technology that benefits everyone. Want to learn more? Please visitwww.workdayeducation.com.About the roleAs a Workday Instructor, you will teach and certify Workday and partner consultants and customers to provide them with product expertise. You should be passionate about the quality of what you do with an intense desire to continue to make everything you are involved in better. You should also be ready to work hard but have a lot of fun doing it!You will have the ability to define the course requirements, create the course deliverables, and see the work through, including delivery of the course. This position requires the ability to collaborate with Development and Product Management to ensure accuracy of course content and use of functionality, and Professional Services and Product Support for relevancy of course offerings.You will• Become an expert in the Workday reporting and integration tools• Teach a variety of classes, both Instructor Led and Virtual Instructor Led• Collaborate with content development team to define course structure, content, and delivery method to produce high quality training• Obtain a deep knowledge of Workday applications and work across functional teams to stay current with rapidly evolving enhancements• Build relationships across teams to meet goals• Learn and quickly master new product functionality• Share your knowledge and experience with your students to get their Workday career off to a great start!This position can be located in any metro market.About YouThe ideal candidate will be able to teach the Workday reporting and integration tools to diverse audiences, including customers, implementation consultants, partners, and application developers.You should be passionate about the quality of what you do with an intense desire to continue to make everything you are involved in better. You should also be ready to work hard but have a lot of fun doing it!Our successful candidates have a strong background in full scale ERP deployments and training. They work hard, they love to learn, and they are ready for a challenge!You have• 3-5 years implementing reporting and/or integration solutions with Human Resource, Payroll or Financial ERP application software• 3+ years integrating systems with third-party service vendors• Strong technical aptitude, including designing and building reports, a command of Service Oriented Architecture Concepts, experience with EDI, Web Services, XML, XSLT, Java, .Net or other integration technologies, and WebLogic, WebSphere, WebMethods, or other middleware experience• Excellent problem solving skills and the ability to independently manage projects• Ability to communicate concepts in a concise, logical manner so students can absorb and retain• Passion for learning, teaching, and mastering complex system functionality• Ability to comfortably and confidently present to large groups of 20+ people using a variety of delivery methods, for lengthy periods of time• Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal• Ability to learn technology quickly through instruction and self-training and the flexibility to adapt to a changing environment• Preference will be given to candidates with experience designing, building, and delivering training to a technical audience.• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent, relevant working experience is required. Advanced degree preferred.• Some travel will be required (up to 25%)*LI-PF1

items.title: Remote Partner Service Representative– Full Time Openings
items.content:
The 700 Club Prayer Center – greater Nashville, TN

 The Christian Broadcasting Network (CBN) is looking for Full Time Partner Service Representatives to work remotely with our call center team.  This remote opportunity is ideal for a dedicated professional who is passionate about the mission of CBN and enjoys interacting with the public. This is a phone support position that will communicate with established and prospective CBN partners to encourage financial support, inform, and minister through prayer using accepted biblical doctrine.

 

To prepare you for this exciting opportunity, we offer:

  • Full-time Paid Training On-Site (4 Weeks)
  • All necessary equipment is provided
  • Available Work Schedule:
    • Friday through Tuesday (days off: Wednesday and Thursday) 
    • Thursday through Monday (days off: Tuesday and Wednesday)
  • Competitive pay at $11.50 per hour
  • Full-time Benefits
  • 75% Tuition Discount at Regent University available immediately!

 

Work from Home Requirements:

  • Able to come on-site one day per week during (90-day) Introductory period
  • Reliable high-speed internet access with a minimum of 5Mbps download speed and 1Mbps upload speed (no satellite dish, wireless internet service, or DSL)
  • Distraction-free home work environment

 

Qualifications:

  • Excellent listening skills and ability to empathize with others
  • Knowledge of the Bible and ability to pray concise, scripture-based prayers
  • Ability to communicate professionally with good oral and written communication skills, including proper use of sentence structure, grammar, and spelling
  • Good computer skills including use of Windows-based operating system, web browser, and email program with ability to learn new software
  • Comfortable working at a computer workstation for entire shift
  • Strong reading comprehension skills
  • Ability to work in a structured, fast-paced environment, and adapt to change
  • Ability to self-manage and take appropriate initiative
  • Strong ability to maintain consistent punctuality and attendance
  • Ability to work occasional holidays as needed
  • Excellent ability to maintain confidentiality and safeguard sensitive information
  • Experience with Call Center software a plus

items.title: Psychologist
items.content:
Psychologist at Savant Care

Los Altos, Remote · Full Time
Compensation
$80K–$120K
0.01%–0.02%
Visa Sponsorship
Available

Job Description

A STARTUP HIRING A PSYCHOLOGIST? TELL ME MORE!

About SavantCare:

We have expertise in treating the entire spectrum of mental illness through an integrative approach to psychological well-being — via medications, psychotherapy and alternative treatments.

Most psychiatric care of today does not look much different from that of 20 years ago. At Savant Care we improve the efficiency and quality of psychiatric treatment through the use of cutting-edge technologies. Our practice uses evidence based medicine along with state-of-the-art technology to improve the lives of our patients.

Qualifications:

-Masters or doctorate level degree in Psychology (MFT, LCSW, PSYD, PHD...).
-Must be willing to learn and use our EMR software and are excited about the idea of integrating tech into mental health.
-You are experienced working with diverse populations.
-You like working as part of a team!

Responsibilities:

-You will be managing a patient population using latest mental health technologies developed at Savant care.
-Many of your clients will be referred from our team of psychiatrists and you will have easy communication with the other members of the client's care team.
-As we are working to make SavantCare better each day, we are looking for someone with a friendly, easy-going attitude who can roll with the punches.
-You will also be actively involved in planning the new feature rollouts.

Savant Care Perks:

-You will have an assistant and an excellent EMR to schedule your appts, field phone calls and take care of insurance/billing paperwork etc.
-We will do our best to fill your schedule so you don't have to worry about marketing or advertising.
-We will take care of setting you up in a SavantCare office.
-You'll get to work with a great group of professionals dedicated to improving mental health access and delivery!

Sound like fun? We look forward to meeting you! <3 SavantCare Team.

items.title: Sr. Professional Services Consultant - 14434BR at Synopsys (Boston, MA) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Industry: Hardware, Software Development
Company size: 10k+ people
Company type: Public

Job description

Location: Anywhere in the USA

Why not work for the best in technology?


SYNOPSYS is revolutionizing the development of secure and reliable software. SYNOPSYS Software Integrity Consultants partner with clients who are making technology breakthroughs such as the Curiosity Mars Rover and Large Hadron Collider.


As a SYNOPSYS Consultant, you would lead customers to success in three key areas:

  • Solution design: You engage with the world’s leading technology companies to understand their business needs and solve critical problems concerning software quality and security
  • Solution delivery: You are involved from project initiation to completion with end-to-end ownership of successful results
  • Expert consulting: You become an advisor to our customers providing solution expertise in the domain of software testing and security

To become a SYNOPSYS Consultant, you need:

  • Proven technical aptitude, sharp consulting instincts and a passion for delivering groundbreaking solutions for top tier technology companies
  • Ability to thrive in a demanding environment with clients who have high expectations
  • At least 5 years of technology consulting experience, preferably in software testing and/or application security
  • Preferred candidates will have security certifications such as CEH, CISSP and CSSLP
  • At least 3 years of experience developing in C/C++, Java, C# or other major programming language.
  • Expert knowledge of various software development process models and with procedural and object oriented programming concepts.
  • Strong scripting ability in one or more common scripting languages (Perl, Python, Ruby, shell).
  • Knowledge of build systems and software development tools
  • BS or MS degree in computer science, engineering or other scientific degree
  • Open to travel to customer sites

About Synopsys

Synopsys offers the most comprehensive portfolio of software security solutions in the market. We go beyond traditional testing services to help our clients identify, remediate, and prevent vulnerabilities in the applications that power their business. Our holistic approach to application security offers a balance of managed and professional services and products tailored to fit your specific needs. We don’t stop when the test is over. Our experts also provide remediation guidance, program design services, and training that empower you to build and maintain secure applications.

Benefits

Unlimited PTO
Medical, Dental, Vision
401(k)
Commuter program
Performance bonus
Competitive salaries
Tuition reimbursement
Gym membership reimbursement
Employee stock purchase program

items.title: Small Firm Technology Leader (Remote) at Dorsia Investment Group LLC () (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior, Lead, Manager
Industry: Finance
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Our firm

We’re a small investment firm in New York, run by two quants. Even though we’ve been trading stocks successfully since 2012, we have never hired anybody to help – we have done all the strategy, trading, and technology ourselves. Our focus is on the investment strategy, but we are good coders and have built a solid infrastructure for a two-man operation.

Now it’s time to take off, and we’re hiring a small team to expand the business.

Here’s where you come in—

We need a top notch tech guru to lead the entire tech of our firm as we expand. Think of it as a CTO type role – you will report directly to the founders. You’d have a wide range of skills (enterprise IT admin, app dev) and be managing everything – from finding the right enterprise solutions as we expand, to extending our Python quantitative backend infrastructure, to managing databases, networks and permissions. Everything technology-related will be under your purview. And at least initially, you will be the only person on our team focused on tech full-time.

Our culture is casual with a start-up feel. We care deeply about efficiency and robust tech, but not how you choose to manage your schedule. We care about our lifestyles but don’t want to dictate yours. You’ll be working remotely but will have constant access to the founders, who will give you feedback and growth.

Ideal candidate would have:

  • Top notch coding skills. You will need to be able write robust, clean code with a focus on extensibility and performance. We use Python throughout, but as tech lead you might decide e.g. Java/C++ is more suitable for a particular solution.
  • Experience with hedge fund technology (managing positions, broker data, market data, etc.) a big plus.
  • Experience with databases and managing data.
  • Experience with configuring and permissioning enterprise apps for a growing organization.
  • Experience with integration of back-end systems with Excel. Currently we use PyXLL, a cool system that integrates a Python backend with Excel.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to work remotely and manage your own schedule.
  • Creativity and being highly proactive in your solutions, passion about tech and coding, and staying well-informed of cool new solutions for tech problems.

Benefits

Remote Work

items.title: Small Firm Technology Leader
items.content:
Our firm


We’re a small investment firm in New York, run by two quants. Even though we’ve been trading stocks successfully since 2012, we have never hired anybody to help – we have done all the strategy, trading, and technology ourselves. Our focus is on the investment strategy, but we are good coders and have built a solid infrastructure for a two-man operation.


Now it’s time to take off, and we’re hiring a small team to expand the business.


Here’s where you come in—


We need a top notch tech guru to handle the entire tech infrastructure of our firm as we expand. Think of it as a one-man CTO type role – you will report directly to the founders. You’d have a wide range of skills (enterprise IT admin, app dev) and be managing everything infrastructure-related from top to bottom – from finding the right enterprise solutions as we expand, to extending our Python quantitative backend, to managing databases, networks and permissions. At least initially, you will be the only person on our team focused on tech full-time (i.e. not a managerial role).


Our culture is casual with a start-up feel. We care deeply about efficiency and robust tech, but not how you choose to manage your schedule. We care about our lifestyles but don’t want to dictate yours. You’ll be working remotely but will have constant access to the founders, who will give you feedback and growth.


Some examples of projects you might do:



  • Manage permissions and active directory, set up a VPN or figure out a virtual desktop solution if required.

  • Create a desktop/web app with integrated views on the firm’s P&L and risk.

  • Maintain database of tick data received from third-party vendors and write high-performance accessor functions in Python.

  • Integrate an on-demand market data service, e.g. Factset, into our Python environment with high-performance queries or batching API calls with intelligent caching.

  • Create a lightweight alert system for Windows to warn us of upcoming earnings and other time-critical events.

  • Create a system that integrates real-time positions from our brokers into Python and Excel.

  • Create automated trade reports to send to a middle-office team.


Ideal candidate would have:



  • Top notch coding skills. You will need to be able write robust, clean code with a focus on extensibility and performance. We use Python throughout, but as tech lead you might decide e.g. Java/C++ is more suitable for a particular solution for performance.

  • Experience with hedge fund infrastructure (position tracking, broker data, market data, etc.) a big plus. Experience developing trading strategies not required.

  • Experience with managing databases and writing highly efficient queries..

  • Experience with configuring and permissioning enterprise IT for a growing organization.

  • Experience with integration of back-end infrastructure with Excel is a plus. Currently we use PyXLL, a cool system that integrates a Python backend with Excel.

  • Strong communication skills and ability to work remotely and manage your own schedule.

  • Creativity and being highly proactive in your solutions, passionate about tech and coding, and staying well-informed of cool new solutions for tech problems.

items.title: Mobile Massage Therapists
items.content:
Mobile Massage Therapists at Blys

Australia, Remote · Contract
Skills
Massage Therapy, Certified Massage Therapist
Compensation
$10K–$50K
No Equity

Job Description

+ Earn up to $75/hour
+ Be your own boss - work when you want
+ Minimum travel - get jobs in your local area

Blys is a pioneering new, on-demand mobile massage service - seamlessly connecting qualified therapists with clients looking for professional massage in the comfort of their home.

We are looking to expand our network of elite therapists across Australia - to help us deliver the best mobile massage experience in Australia.

This is a great opportunity for qualifying students or fully qualified practitioners who are looking to earn extra money and work with flexible hours.

-----------------

What Blys offers you:

- More money. Fill the gaps in your calendar with extra hours from Blys customers. Earn up to 75% of massage fees and get paid instantly after a massage.

- Boss title. You set your own schedule and decide when you'll accept jobs - no obligations.

- No creeps. We collect personal details of all Blys customers + verify customers’ credit card before we confirm a booking so you can feel safe and confident when taking appointments.

- A better you. We collect feedback from our customers and share them with you - to help you improve your service over time.

- Chance to kickstart your career. If you’re an up-and-coming massage therapist with qualifications and seeking hands-on experience, Blys is the perfect platform for you.

-----------------

What we are looking for:

- Cert IV in Massage Therapy (minimum), or Diploma of Remedial (preferred). Membership of industry associations (e.g. AMT) is a bonus.

- Your own ABN and insurance

- Your own equipment - massage table, sheets, oil or lotion, music and transportation from/to customers

- Skills, knowledge and most importantly passion about therapeutic massage.

- Excellent customer service and communication skills

- Flexibility and willingness to work various hours, including evenings and weekends

-----------------

Apply today via:

www.getblys.com.au/apply

0.0%–5.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

We are looking for an experienced CFO who is looking for the "next big thing" and has extensive experience working with tech startups all the way to public entities. Knows how to network, has existing relationships with all the VC firms that matter and is willing to bleed for the company to make it successful.

You are someone who can help us perfect our financial models and shake the money trees harder than anyone before.

The right CFO for us will be someone that once they believe in our business, can work closely with the CEO to execute our Series A roadshow.

In exchange, we are looking to grant a very attractive salary, equity and benefits.

** Until we close Series A, salary/benefits will be deferred. Stock vesting will begin immediately upon signing employment agreement. **

items.title: Secret Benefits: Sick Of Polishing Turds?
items.content:
Sick Of Polishing Turds?

Posted Sep 29

Secret Benefits
Headquarters: The World
http://secretbenefits.com

Fed up trying to market a product that no one wants? Knowing that however much polish you add, it's still a turd? Or perhaps you're one of a 10-person marketing department where getting an idea tested requires more political acumen than creative genius? Or maybe you love your work but hate the commute, and the costs to your lifestyle?

Secret Benefits is a sugar dating site that users love, has no bureaucracy, and understands that life comes before work. We're only a young site but according to this user, we're doing OK:

"It’s fantastic!! Amazing like life changing! Thank you very much!! A very satisfied customer!!"

This testimonial's so glowing that I'd be foolish to make it up. I considered fixing the grammar but decided I liked the rawness. As a marketer, you understand that changing lives is a good start but there's more to success. We may have thousands of users but most people haven't heard of us, like you before seeing this curious job listing -- come help us change that. 

If you've got any experience getting the word out about a product, or in generating publicity, we want to hear from you. When you join, you'll make up 50% of our dedicated marketing team. You'll interact daily with the co-owners, and have your ideas live and tested almost as quickly as you come up with them. Spend time implementing, and reviewing your concepts, not waiting for them to be approved by 3 VPs.

We're a young, motivated team that's entirely remote and distributed globally. Sick of that commute, or reminding the in-person team that you're still alive? Here we're all in the same position. You dictate when and where you do the work -- fit it around your life without feeling guilty.

We know little about Social Media and PR. These are the two major gaps we're trying to fill. But if you've got experience in other areas like email marketing, PPC, branding, or anything else, we'd still love to hear from you.  

Apply for this position

To apply, please send your best proof of being able to help us to apply@secretbenefits.com Hint: A track record of success, particularly if it's in PR or social media, is what we're especially interested in.
